perturbation.original_text: PaperExchange shall then have three business days after receipt of such notice to (a) accept or reject such advertiser, in its reasonable business discretion, and (b) notify VerticalNet of its decision. If, at the end of such three-day period, PaperExchange has not responded to such notice, PaperExchange shall be deemed to have accepted such advertiser.
perturbation.changed_text: PaperExchange shall then have one business day after receipt of such notice to (a) accept or reject such advertiser, in its reasonable business discretion, and (b) notify VerticalNet of its decision. If, at the end of such one-day period, PaperExchange has not responded to such notice, PaperExchange shall be deemed to have accepted such advertiser.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the response time for accepting or rejecting advertisers to one business day may be deemed unreasonably short, especially given the need for due diligence and internal consultations. This could be seen as an unfair business practice and potentially violate regulations related to fair contracting and business dealings, especially where PaperExchange might require more time to properly vet potential advertisers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of fair business practices and contracting laws.

perturbation.original_text: The Receiving Party shall notify the Originating Party of its approval or disapproval of such advertising materials as soon as practicable, but in any event within five business days after Receiving Party's receipt thereof. Any failure of the Receiving Party to respond within such five business day period shall be deemed disapproval of the advertising materials in question.
perturbation.changed_text: The Receiving Party shall notify the Originating Party of its approval or disapproval of such advertising materials as soon as practicable, but in any event within one business day after Receiving Party's receipt thereof. Any failure of the Receiving Party to respond within such one business day period shall be deemed disapproval of the advertising materials in question.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the approval/disapproval timeframe for advertising materials to one business day puts undue pressure on the Receiving Party. This is an unreasonably short period that may hinder proper review. Such a compressed timeline could raise concerns about fair dealing and potentially violate implied duties of good faith and fair dealing present in contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of implied duty of good faith and fair dealing in contract law.

perturbation.original_text: During the 18-month period following the payment by one party of any amount due under this Agreement to the other party, the party receiving payment (the "Auditing Party") shall have the right to have an independent third party (the "Auditor") audit the financial records of the other party (the "Audited Party") relating to such payment to verify the accuracy of the Audited Party's financial records in order to verify the amount of the payments owed and/or paid.
perturbation.changed_text: During the 6-month period following the payment by one party of any amount due under this Agreement to the other party, the party receiving payment (the "Auditing Party") shall have the right to have an independent third party (the "Auditor") audit the financial records of the other party (the "Audited Party") relating to such payment to verify the accuracy of the Audited Party's financial records in order to verify the amount of the payments owed and/or paid.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the audit period to 6 months may be considered an unreasonably short timeframe to allow for proper financial review and could potentially contradict accepted accounting practices or regulations that recommend a longer period for audit rights, especially in complex financial relationships. This may be seen as restricting the ability of the Auditing Party to fully assess the financial accuracy of the payments, potentially conflicting with principles of fairness and transparency in contractual relationships.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential conflict with accepted accounting practices and regulations regarding audit rights.
